subject: Re: [junit] Anyone know of a decent debugger?
msgSnippet: ... If stepping through the code leads to more valuable tests, then all the better.  The important part is to ensure that the lessons taught by the debugger
messageBody:
"Holliday, Donald B. (LNG-SHEP)" wrote:

> <snip>If you write the unit tests first (one would presume using JUnit),
> what is the value of also stepping through each line of code?</snip>
>
> I guess you're better at writing absolutely complete tests than I am. It is
> not unusual for me to notice boundary conditions while stepping through code
> that I failed to notice when I wrote the tests.
>

If stepping through the code leads to more valuable tests, then all the better. The
important part is to ensure that the lessons taught by the debugger make their way back
into an automated test.

Mike

--
Mike Clark
